lexa.core.data

Interface DataFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayFactory, BaseFactory, ConfigFactory, HashFactory

    public interface DataFactory
    Factory to create consistent instances for DataSets and their components.
    Since:
    2017-04
    Author:
    william

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • checkFactory

        boolean checkFactory(DataFactory factory)
        Compare two factories to check they produce the same type of data objects
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory to compare against this.
        Returns:
        true if they are the same type of factory, otherwise false

      • clone

        DataArray clone(DataArray array)
        Clone a DataArray. Create a clone of the provided DataArray that is consistent with this DataFactory. This will always result in a deep copy.
        Parameters:
        array - the DataArray to be cloned.
        Returns:
        a new DataArray of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • clone

        DataSet clone(DataSet data)
        Clone a DataSet. Create a clone of the provided DataSet that is consistent with this DataFactory. This will always result in a deep copy.
        Parameters:
        data - the DataSet to be cloned.
        Returns:
        a new DataSet of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • clone

        DataItem clone(DataItem item)
        Clone a DataItem. Create a clone of the provided DataItem that is consistent with this DataFactory. This will always result in a deep copy.
        Parameters:
        item - the DataItem to be cloned.
        Returns:
        a new DataItem of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • clone

        DataValue clone(DataValue value)
        Clone a DataValue. Create a clone of the provided DataValue that is consistent with this DataFactory. This will always result in a deep copy.
        Parameters:
        value - the DataValue to be cloned.
        Returns:
        a new DataValue of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • clone

        java.lang.Object clone(java.lang.Object object)
        Clone an Object. Create a clone of the provided Object that is consistent with this DataFactory. This will always result in a deep copy of any components
        Parameters:
        object - the Object to be converted.
        Returns:
        a Object of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • convert

        DataArray convert(DataArray array)
        Convert a DataArray. Make sure that the DataArray is of the type supported by this DataFactory and if it is a different type then create a clone.
        Parameters:
        array - the DataArray to be converted.
        Returns:
        a DataArray of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • convert

        DataItem convert(DataItem item)
        Convert a DataItem. Make sure that the DataItem is of the type supported by this DataFactory and if it is a different type then create a clone.
        Parameters:
        item - the DataItem to be converted.
        Returns:
        a DataItem of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • convert

        DataSet convert(DataSet data)
        Convert a DataSet. Make sure that the DataSet is of the type supported by this DataFactory and if it is a different type then create a clone.
        Parameters:
        data - the DataSet to be converted.
        Returns:
        a DataSet of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • convert

        DataValue convert(DataValue value)
        Convert a DataValue. Make sure that the DataValue is of the type supported by this DataFactory and if it is a different type then create a clone.
        Parameters:
        value - the DataValue to be converted.
        Returns:
        a DataValue of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • convert

        java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Object object)
        Convert an Object. Make sure that the Object is of the type supported by this DataFactory and if it is a different type then create a clone.
        Parameters:
        object - the Object to be converted.
        Returns:
        a Object of the type supported by this DataFactory with the same content.

      • getDataArray

        DataArray getDataArray()
        Create a new DataArray
        Returns:
        an empty DataArray of the type supported by this DataFactory.

      • getDataItem

        DataItem getDataItem(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Create a new DataItem
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the item
        value - the value for the item
        Returns:
        a DataItem of the type supported by this DataFactory with the key and value

      • getDataSet

        DataSet getDataSet()
        Create a new DataSet
        Returns:
        an empty DataSet of the type supported by this DataFactory.

      • getDataValue

        DataValue getDataValue(java.lang.Object object)
        Create a new DataValue
        Parameters:
        object - the object for the item
        Returns:
        a DataValue of the type supported by this DataFactory with the object
